alert.note: Alert for Bell; Clay; Harlan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Harlan, northeastern Bell, southern Leslie and southeastern Clay Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Beverly, or 13 miles northwest of Harlan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Spruce Pine around 225 PM EDT. Warbranch around 230 PM EDT. Mozelle and Bledsoe around 235 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Chappell, Napier, Causey, Big Fork, Big Laurel, Big Rock, Yeaddiss, Pine Mountain and Putney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
